definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: The rebellion was started by some malcontents who had been dissatisfied with the policy.
sentences.chinese: 造反源於那些對於政策不滿的人。

sentences.english: The rebels defiantly welcomed new allies and laid plans for unionization campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 造反派熱烈歡迎新盟友，並制訂組織工會的計劃。

sentences.english: The rebel factions made common cause to overthrow the regime.
sentences.chinese: 各造反派聯合起來共同推翻政府。

sentences.english: There can only be eternal rebellion, because human poverty is eternal.
sentences.chinese: 因爲人類的貧困是永恆，所有才會有永恆的造反。

sentences.english: they proclaimed. They rebelled against everything and wreaked havoc everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 他們宣稱“造反有理”，反對一切並大肆毀滅破壞。

sentences.english: Even though in the prison, he tried to persuade the jailer to rebel!
sentences.chinese: 關在牢裏，還要勸牢頭造反。

sentences.english: When the second dice will give Liang Feihu feibook news.
sentences.chinese: 色子將大二當造反的消息用飛鴿傳書給梁飛虎。

sentences.english: But now, merely depend ashore 4,000 Vinaceous Rosefinch soldiers, haven't rebeled of ability.
sentences.chinese: 而現在，僅僅依靠四千朱雀軍，還沒有造反的能力。
造反派戰士和囚犯相互輝映。

sentences.english: The war booty was shared between a rebellious prince of Toungio and the king of Arakan.
sentences.chinese: 造反的東籲親王與阿拉乾的國王分享戰利品。

sentences.english: The rebels occupied the post office.
The neoconservative policy response to an undead uprising would be simple and direct.
sentences.chinese: 新保守主義對亡靈造反的政策迴應是簡單而直接的。

sentences.english: Oppression drove them into open rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 壓迫逼得他們公開造反。

sentences.english: A humiliated pretender governed a rump kingdom from Bourges in the south.
sentences.chinese: 造反勢力是由覬覦王位者領導的。

sentences.english: The subjection of the rebels took a long time.
sentences.chinese: 征服這些造反派花了很長時間。

sentences.english: No single Ming general want to rebel and Li finally seized Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 沒有單一明總想造反，李終於攻克了北京。

definition: to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
(of a warlord etc) to assemble one's personal army, thereby presenting a challenge to the central government
to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt
